Reviews.Title: “Central Location for our Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 8 nights at this hotel. The location was great for us. Check-in was a breeze, and our room was spacious enough for the two of us. Unfortunately it faced Sunset Boulevard, which carries a substantial amount of traffic. After a few nights we moved to a room across the hall, which was much quieter. We had a nice stay here and I would have given them a higher review except for one thing - we had no internet service in our room. At first we were told it was because we have Macs. Come on people - Apple products will find wifi before you can even blink! We were in room 322 initially and then changed to 321 in the hopes of getting wifi. We got a quieter room but no internet service. I am surprised that no other reviewers have complained about this. In the second room my daughter was finally able to connect her MacBook to the internet via an ethernet cable. (Same cable did not work in the first room.) I had to sit in the lobby with my iPad when I wanted to get on the internet. For a one or two night stay, it would have been no big deal. But for eight nights it became more than an inconvenience. I will also point out that the wifi is unsecured - no password is needed to login so be careful when you use the internet there. I also wish that they had a workout room at this location. The other Comfort Inns we stayed in on this trip had them, and I certainly could have used it for this many days. Other than that we enjoyed our stay here. The breakfast area was nicely maintained and there was a nice variety of items available, which we appreciated with our long stay. As others have mentioned, there are only a few tables so we did end up taking the food back to our room a few times. I would definitely consider staying here again when I come back to visit my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Silverlake!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Silverlake (walk down to the Olive Motel to compare if you so desire!) I come to this little gem every year and have always had great accommodations. Plus, the view facing Sunset is pretty nice. Free breakfast is still free breakfast which is a good way to start off the day. If you choose to see the city via walking, there is a bus stop a stone's throw away from the lobby or you can take a good little walk to Red Line station. Always felt very safe at this place, never heard any noises (of any kind) and check-in / check-out was fast and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sators
Reviews.Content: Hotel isn't steller, but isn't that bad either. Has a parking garage for overnight guests. Accommodations are tolerable. Breakfast room is far too small with too little seating. If you are staying multiple nights, you have to get your key card redone every night - annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, much more than expected”
Reviews.Author: RA8
Reviews.Content: My wife and had to spend one night in West Hollywood, CA on March 10, 2012. To be honest, nothing looked all that great. The area in and around Hollywood isn't what it was when I was a child. Here at this recently remodeled Comfort Inn we got way more than expected and paid for, close to everything Hollywood. A secure underground parking brought us directly into the lobby. The desk registration was smooth and just like that we were in a nice size room, flat screen TV, a standard size bath but almost as nice as home. Plenty of comfy pillows on the king size bed Next morning the desk provided free razor and shave cream. We came down to a full breakfast that satisfied well into the afternoon. Will only stay at this little jewel if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “A really good value”
Reviews.Author: nanm00
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased to have discovered this Comfort Inn near Echo Park relatives' home. All the usual basic Comfort Inn features including full breakfast are perfectly done. Reception and service personnel are friendly and efficient. Plus the place appears overall super-tidy, well maintained and quite secure. Spacious room faced the quiet neighborhood street, but we could hear noise from the hall thru the sort of thin door, thus the 4 out of 5. Loved the free parking and the easy freeway access. Sure beats staying downtown at over twice the price! And, then there's that rotating podiatrist sign...ask a local about the cult of Happy Foot / Sad Foot. We saw Happy. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, marred by ridiculous security policy!”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Comfort Inn, about a year after my first visit in January 2011. The parking garage is very convenient, the bed is nice and firm, the shower is reasonably good, and the wi-fi is free. The attendant at the front desk even went out of his way to help me print a document with their printer. My only complaint with this hotel is their ridiculous policy of resetting the electronic room locks every day, supposedly for security purposes. Three times I was locked out of my room because I was unaware of this policy, and each time I went to the front desk to have my room key reprogrammed. On each occasion, I provided my room number but was not asked for my name or ID, and yet my key was reset to open the room I specified. I could have gotten access to ANY room in this manner. How exactly is this supposed to improve security?!? When I checked out, I asked about this policy, and I was told that guests were losing their room keys with the envelope that indicates their room number. So in an attempt to solve that problem, the policy actually reduces the security for all guests. Hey Comfort Inn, here's a better idea: don't write the room number on an envelope that holds the room keys!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay...”
Reviews.Author: minggirl1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for the Los Angeles visitor that wants to be near all the Silverlake & Echo Park action. I stayed here for 4 days in November. The staff was very friendly and the rate wasn't bad at all for the area. It's located in a hilariously ugly "strip mall" style parking lot. But the giant "Foot clinic" sign (God, I wish I had taken a picture!!), sort of added to the charm, I suppose. There's excellent food and coffee options within walking distance. I highly recommend "Local" - about 2 blocks north on Sunset. And the vegan Thai restaurant that is right next door was supposed to be really good. I didn't get the chance to try it. The room itself (I stayed in a non-smoking King) was very spacious. The bed was pretty comfortable but the bedding and pillows left alot to be desired. Some of the furniture was worn and older as well. Overall, though, it was a well equipped room - large flat screen tv. dresser, desk, table with two chairs, microwave, coffee maker, closet with iron and board, and two large windows. I asked for a quiet room, so I wasn't bothered by any traffic noise from Sunset Blvd. The bathroom was modern and nice, but the sink was just outside the bathroom - sort of strange. There is also an underground garage which is great for LA. Overall a good place to stay ant a decent price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Safe Neighborhood, Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: HouseFairy
Reviews.Content: We chose this property for its location, in the vicinity of our daughter's rental home. On previous trips to LA we have stayed @ Magic Castle and other hotels, but this humble motel will be our top choice in the future. The management and staff were efficient and friendly; our room was spotless, spacious, well-appointed, and quiet. Snacks were available in the breakfast area throughout the day. Our room, which cost $216 including taxes for TWO nights, had a large refrigerator, microwave oven, shower/tub, separate sink area, table, chairs, desk. The king bed had about a half-dozen spherical bed pillows. Amenities included face soap, body soap, shampoo, and lotion. Don't stay here for the view; but choose it for security and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “very economical and fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: DORDubai
Reviews.Content: it is near to majority of LA locations. Convenient stay for the price you pay. Parking is free, which can save you around 15 - 20 USD. per day.The breakfast is ok as well. Fit for purpose budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: LorelaiLii
Reviews.Content: This very humble-looking Comfort Inn, which shares a car park with a vegan restaurant and a foot clinic, is a good choice for a stay in the LA area. Right on Sunset Blvd, it is a short, direct drive to most of the Hollywood attractions. Free parking in a well-lit parking garage is a plus; The beds and showers are standard Comfort Inn accommodations--good, yet nothing special--and the rooms are quite large. Free wi-fi was a nice surprise, as was the quiet air conditioner. The housekeeping staff does excellent, quiet work keeping the rooms very clean. .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gerard-advisor
Reviews.Content: Very clean, friendly service, free wifi, cheap price and very close to the main attractions on Hollywood boul. I would highly recommend for anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: iamanshul
Reviews.Content: Great location and good value for money. Choose more for location than the hotel

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay, modest hotel for a modest price”
Reviews.Author: Hum4n_Traffic
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of hotel that you want when travelling, all the basics were covered: - free secure parking - short drive to downtown / hollywood / freeway on ramps to head in any direction - free wifi - free breakfast - cereal, fruit, pastries, toast, diy waffle machine (yum!), yoghurt, juice, tea, coffee. Vending machines in the carpark - spacious room - microwave and bar fridge. Ours had a view of the silverlake hills. - Windows that open - this is always a plus for me, nothing like some fresh air, also helps to gauge what kind of day it is outside, those LA mornings can be deceiving! - Generally clean and presentable - every morning there was a guy sweeping and hosing the front area and carpark. Its an older building with new renovations inside, most notable the bathroom - staff were friendly and helpful - especially one guy that seemed to always be at reception (didn't get his name!) he was training a new guy when we checked in and was patiently ensuring the new guy was providing a quality service. I read a few reviews on here about it being a dodgy neighbourhood but I didn't see it. Unless it's the big foot clinic sign that's putting ppl off? lol Its also close to a Laundromat and a few eating places and convenience stores The only gripe I had was less to do with the hotel and more with the other guests. The rooms aren't completely sound proof, so you may hear the odd loud tv, slamming of doors or running up and down the hall but im not going to be one of those ppl that mark the hotel down on the inconsiderate actions of others, and lets face it, youre going to get those ppl no matter where you stay. Overall, a pleasant stay, modest hotel for a modest price, definitely rates at the higher end for mid-range hotels. Recommended (:

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Saraleemacdonald
Reviews.Content: When we got there we were greeted by friendly staff. Our room was better than many we had stayed in previously. Even better than La Quinta over near LAX, We liked the covered parking and the fact that it was free. It was nice to have the elevator to the parking garage and to the room function as one. At La Quinta last week they had separate elevators. We liked the Vegan House Restaurant next door. The room was clean The hotel was 3 minutes away from the Cathedral Center of St. Paul where my meeting was in the morning. I loved the continental breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Well run , clean and very good value”
Reviews.Author: fsweeney
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for three nights in june 11. The staff were friendly and helpful (they printed my boarding pass for me and gave good advice about parking. They also allowed me to check out half an hour later. Plenty of shops and bars nearby. It straddles the Silver Lake/Echo Park area. Dont be put off by the nondescript exterior, the rooms are spacious and well maintained with a coffee machine. The inclusive breakfast has a good selection of bread, cakes cereals and juices. I recommend you get breakfast early as the breakfast bar is a bit short of seating, but it doesn't run out of food. There are good public transport connections to the metro and you can get the 704 bus out to Santa Monica door to door. Although its on sunset boulevard there is good sound insulation. The WiFI was very reliable and a decent speed. This is a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mrmnem
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there with a colleague, travelling from NYC for business, and had rooms on the second floor. Although the place has some drawbacks (i.e very thin walls, so you easily hear TV or people from nearby rooms, some gross stains on the curtains in my room, only a veggie fast food to have dinner on site, otherwise you need to drive), the place is still a good value: less than 5 miles from downtown L.A (and the drive is pretty smooth even at peak hours), the breakfast buffet is more than decent, rooms are pretty large, comfortable and offer free internet access, and free parking is available on site, that's hard to beat for this price ($100 a night). Not THE greatest hotel I've ever been to, but pretty decent for such low prices. Very good value I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel_495
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family visit to LA. Stayed at this Comfort Inn as it was right around the corner from my brother's house. Rooms were very clean and in good shape. Very spacious. Water pressure was good. TV has lots of channels. Checked for bed bugs (always do) and none were to be found. Yeah! Lighted covered parking was nice for our rental car. Found it strange that we had to re-key our room keys each day but understand that it is a security measure and like that. Beds could have been more comfortable; ours was a little hard and pillows were lumpy. We were on the Sunset side so the traffic was very loud - just a warning to light sleepers. Breakfast was nice even though we didn't eat anything. I had OJ and read the paper one morning which was convenient. Would definitely stay here again since it's affordable, exactly what we need and clean.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, nice and very clean rooms for a great price”
Reviews.Author: mintkiwi
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location, just two blocks from Hollywood Blvd and Walk of fame, and is situated in a lovely district. There are 7eleven, sturbucks and two bars just nearby. Rooms are very clean, spacy and comfortable, there is even a coffee machine in the room. I would say the room in Comfort Inn was better then we had in a more expensive hotels. The hotel also has a free parking and a small swimming pool. Hotel's stuff is friendly and helpful. So being in LA for a next time we would definitely book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, inexpensive hotel in a delightful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: From_Delaware
Reviews.Content: After three visits over several months I am completely satisfied with this Comfort Inn and charmed by its surroundings in Silver Lake, Echo Park and Los Feliz. Remember this is a Comfort Inn, not a luxury hotel, and you'll find your expectations in the right place. My rooms have all been clean, comfortable and secure. The mattresses, pillows and bedding are in excellent condition. Wireless internet service is fast, reliable and free. Climate control unit works well and isn't too loud. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure. Lots of channels of cable TV. Free covered parking also is a big plus. And then there's the room rate, which so far has been remarkably economical for LA. Don't be put off by the external appearance: the hotel is on the second and third floors of a somewhat rundown-looking small retail plaza, and the reception desk is behind thick plexiglass of the type you might normally associate with a liquor store in a sketchy neighborhood. No worries: the rooms, while a bit spartan, are just fine. And everything is in quite good condition. And the neighborhood appears quite safe by big-city standards. The other guests I've seen or met seem very nice. Plenty of young people seeing LA on a budget, which is fun to be around now that I'm well past my Youth Hostel years. Oh, and twice I've shared a late nightcap in the breakfast room with some touring indie band just wrapping up a show at one of the nearby clubs. All very friendly, and I've never had a problem with noise at night. The neighborhood is conveniently walkable, bikeable and busable -- moreso than you'd expect in LA. 15 minutes walk in either direction on Sunset will give you plenty to eat, drink, hear, see or buy. I got to Hollywood in less than 20 minutes by bus. I have only two minor quibbles. One is the breakfast, which not of the highest quality (but there's plenty else around in the neighborhood). The other is the air freshener the housekeepers use in the guest rooms, which is very strong and they seem to use a lot of it. But as I said, these are minor and they won't in any way prevent my return on future visits to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: Mannie131
Reviews.Content: We felt this hotel was above standard for the Comfort Inn brand. The room was very comfortable, spacious and well equipped. We had a car and the location was perfect for starting most of our LA adventures. The local area had many good restaurants and terrific fish taco stands. Good location for catching buses across town as well.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: atraveller082010
Reviews.Content: 1. booked for Non-smoking, got a smoking room 2. called to change for a different room, was told none was available, and was not refund my money even when I cancelled my reservation 3. mad staff on the phone

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly appealing”
Reviews.Author: susanjames
Reviews.Content: This property is tucked into a strip center in a commercial/residential Echo Lake neighborhood on Sunset Blvd. It lacks any amenities like pool, business center or gym, but has a free underground garage that is locked after 10 p.m. Upon our 9 p.m. arrival, we found the desk clerk sitting behind a bullet proof glass screen, reminiscent of a money exchange, who wrote up our contract for a higher rate and for fewer days than specified in our confirmed reservation. However after a moment's conversation, he corrected the problem and checked us in. The hallway to our 3rd floor room was carpeted in worn, green carpet that suggested replacement. But the spartanly furnished room was very clean, quiet and functional. The complementary breakfast the next morning was surprisingly appealing, offering fresh coffee, juice, fruit, donuts, pastries, cold cereal and hot waffles. The breakfast area was constantly attended by an employee who kept it clean and replenished the food and drinks. This made our three day stay here rather pleasant. We will return and recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Tstover
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA and I was very nervous when selecting a room. I did extensive research on Trip Advisor prior to booking. Upon visiting this hotel for check in I was slightly disappointed just because it was not as close to all of the action as I was hoping. However, after checking in and bringing up our bags, I was very happy that I chose it. The room was very clean and spacious enough for my family of 4. We really only used the room for sleeping purposes and breakfast of course. There was plenty of adequate FREE parking, a nice continental breakfast, a comfortable and clean room along with very easy access to the highway to get anywhere we wanted to go. I would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: enessa51
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Inn was located perfectly for us as it was just a few blocks from the venues of the Turner Classic Movie Festival we were attending. The cost was reasonable, the hotel was clean, bed was comfortable and parking was easy. The hotel employees were friendly and Anisur, the desk clerk went over and above the call of duty to make sure we were happy and comfortable. There were two minor negatives. We ate the breakfast offered only twice in the six days we were there (small eating area, not much choice), but the neighborhood offered several choices within a few blocks walking distance and the air freshener or cleaning products used in the room, while not offensive, were too strongly scented and took a week of airing my suitcase after to get rid of the smell. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: Bingenheimer
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a weekend while seeing a concert at Spaceland. While the guestroom interiors are nothing to write home about, the location to Silver Lake and environs is key. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in was speedy even though they were training a new associate. The expended continental breakfast was more than adequate and the parking was free, a real bonus in L.A. All in all, a positive experience and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: mrsgravel
Reviews.Content: I originally had booked two nights and due to a change of plans cancelled one and confirmed the other. The cancellation was made forty eight hours in advance, when I arrived they had charged me for the day I canceled (later refunded) and the young women at the desk was the same women I had asked to cancel the day. Even though I had gotten her name she claimed not have received my request. I had to see the manager next morning in order to ensure my refund, it made me a little apprehensive. The room was in the front of the building facing sunset. It was so noisy I had to take medication to sleep. This is a room that should only be given out if there is nothing else available and it did'nt look that bus;y to me. What was supose to be a restfull night before my return home turned out to be anything but. I will say the room was well appointed and very clean, just a lousy place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “comfort”
Reviews.Author: kuhrt
Reviews.Content: Large bed, clean hotel, secure parking......breakfast was a minus plus the staff seemed to move with no purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel, great value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights the last week of Dec. Room was a good size, bed was huge and very comfortable. Bathroom was spotless, shower was like new and very good. Continental breakfast is being modest, i'm from ireland and my past experience of continental breakfast is cereal, tea and orange juice. Not here, we had a choice of cereals, cheeses, bagels, doughnuts, bread, fruit, waffles, coffee, tea, milk, orange and apple juice. We really only had interaction with one member of staff, Dietter(sorry if my spelling is incorrect) he was extremely friendly, polite and helpful. I couldnt praise him enough. In terms of location there are better places to stay i suppose, its not hugely far from hollywood or the sunset strip(although u wouldnt walk it) we had a car so it wasnt a huge issue and also the no.2 bus stops right outside and takes you pretty much anywhere, but if you dont like taking the bus or dont have a car i'd prob suggest staying somewhere else. Overall we were extremely happy with this hotel, we had been in Vegas a few days previous and for what we paid in a supposed "upscale" hotel there were NONE of the little extra's that the comfort inn offered for eg: free Wi-Fi, free local calls and a fabolous continental breakfast. We will definitely be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: tlpBethesda
Reviews.Content: I was in town to help my son move in nearby and so it met my every need. It was clean, nice amenities, helpful staff, and very well priced. While it did not have a pool or fitness room (I believe -- I was not interested in them) the location to downtown, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and Santa Monica was easy. There was even good public bus service just outside. The local neighborhood, though not upscale was not in the least threatening and had many convenient shops and restaurants. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a value for LA”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: Close to dodger stadium and other LA attractions. On sunset blvd, down the way from hollywood. Room was clean and gated garage parking was really nice. Area looks sketchy, but nothing to worry about. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quite, but ....”
Reviews.Author: daleski007
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the hotel's area was quiet. However, I cannot recommend this Inn based on the one night I was there for two reasons. First, the Inn would not honor the reservation of my colleague who traveled with me. Apparently another guest overstayed his reservation and, with no other rooms available, the Inn would not kick out that guest so my colleague could have a room. The Inn sent my colleague to another hotel five blocks away. Second, the Inn had entirely insufficient parking. I had to park in a metered space on a busy street b/c the Inn was resurfacing its parking lot. I wish I had known about this before reserving...I would have considered other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A lack of truth in advertising.”
Reviews.Author: Bildo
Reviews.Content: First, the rooms are ok. It's an old hotel, and it shows, but I've stayed in much worse than this. They make you bring your key in every morning to get it revalidated or it won't work. They claim it's because people keep their keys. I've never stayed at a hotel that wasn't able to deactivate a key at checkout before, and it was a slight pain in the neck, but oh well. The problem was the parking. Their website did say that the garage was under construction, but it also said they had parking available. Well, they had very little parking available. I had to park two blocks away on the street. In a hotel where the clerk sits behind bullet proof glass, it's not exactly a comfortable feeling...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kelspeth
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel where the staff leave you in peace but help if you need it.Basic but satisfactory breakfast and free parking. My friend recommended that I stay in this area which is a twenty minute drive from Beverly Hills and West Hollywood because it has lots of character. Great organic restaurants and chilled out bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Blvd, free parking, broadband and that's it”
Reviews.Author: jusaja
Reviews.Content: Quite small rooms with free broadband, free wifi in main lobby, free parking in the yard, free breakfast with doughnuts, etc. though Starbucks just around corner, 7/11 across the street. There is also a very small pool but does not look too attractive. The place is ok if you just need a bed and no extra.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in 10 years.”
Reviews.Author: Laurenantics
Reviews.Content: I was in Los Angeles for a training course and booked three nights here at this hotel due to cost. First - the hotel staff sits behind a bullet proof glass partition. Makes you feel safe? Right?! Second - it's an all smoking hotel. There are ashtrays in the halls on all three floor and the whole place REEKS of cigarette smoke. Third - I came in the day the cleaned the carpet of all three of their floors. Not one floor at a time to insure guests had dry rooms - but all three floors at one time. SO my room had soaking wet and soapy carpet. And there was no where to move me. They were even rude about it when I asked for another room. So I ended up using the comforter on the bed as a dry bridge from the bed to the bathroom so I didn't have to wear my shoes all night. Awful, disgusting and scary place. Horrible location. ICK ICK ICK.

Reviews.Title: “LA to visit daughter”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_AZShredder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in West LA to visit his daughter, who had just moved to this area 3 months ago. We picked this motel location by zip code, because it was closest to her apartment. We had just finished a 4 month long motorcycle trip across the USA, and had spent at least 100 of the past 120 days in motels across the country. This was the first Comfort Inn of this trip, however, even though we had visited Comfort Inns in years past.. First, I have to say that you cannot judge this hotel based upon it's location in W. LA - this area is what it is, and you shouldn't expect anything more than a barrio atmosphere. Be aware of your surroundings and you won't be in danger. We ate at a great Mexican restaurant nearby, named Casita del Campos about one mile from the motel, on Hyperion. Be aware that there is a charge for self parking your car in their lot. The motel itself looks as though it has been renovated. The furnishings are newer, our king sized bed was very comfortable and had 5 pillows. The bedding is clean as were the towels, and bath fixtures. The long review from the lady from NYC from September 2007, explains everything very well, as to room amenities, staff, breakfast, etc. The only complaint is that the carpeting in our room (#211) was filthy. I am also from NYC, and I don't scheeve easily, but our socks were ruined by the dirt, and we won't dare walk barefoot! I took one of the hand towels and rubbed it on the carpet near the bed, and was appalled by the filth it picked up. The carpet and room have a smell (probably caused by the dirty carpet) that permeates the entire area. The odor actually awakened my husband and I during the night. We sprayed the room with Febreze, but it did little to mask the stench. Unfortunately, we are at the beginning of our 2nd night here, (out of 3), and I don't know if I'll be able to tolerate the smell that long. I considered asking the desk clerk if we could change rooms, but I doubt that our room is the only one with dirty, smelly carpet. If you are considering staying at this Comfort Inn location, I would suggest you call the hotel directly, and ask them to put you into a room where the carpet has been recently cleaned. Other than that, the place is perfectly serviceable, if you must spend time in this part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: zmiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like having the vacation from hell! I travel a lot, but this was one of the worst hotels I ever stayed at. I wrote the Choice Hotel corporationl, and they did not even bother to reply to my email. -Construction was going on. -Asked for Non-smoking, got a smoking room - Blood on the sheets, -Cigarette burns on the bed comforters -blood by the basin -asked to change for a different room, was told none was available, and we were not compensated for the poorly maintained room were in.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms but not very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Jon-Mary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in May 2008. The rooms were Ok for the money but I identified two problems. Firstly the location is not very nice and we did not feel comfortable walking in the niehbourhood after dark. Secondly I was not happy with the security. Basically at most times of the day anybody can walk up from the garage area and into the hotel corridors. Admitted there are cameras but I did not feel safe. With the experience of another Comfort Inn we stayed at later in the trip I will not be staying at Comfort anymore. I would recommend staying at Santa Monica if you have to visit Los Angeles/Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, competent, clean”
Reviews.Author: Lit-traveler
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers: This Comfort Inn may be simple and unremarkable in most ways, but it's run by a friendly and caring staff, it's very clean, the rooms are up-to-date and spacious (at least my non-smoking king was), the breakfast is in line with that at comparable motels, and--most of all--the location is excellent for either Downtown or Silver Lake. This access is a real plus, and so is free parking in the building, which would be non-existent in a downtown or West L.A. hotel. I stayed here while attending a meeting at the Los Angeles Convention Center, but also wanted to be able to visit a relative in Silver Lake. The Comfort Inn, as others have noted, is really a mile or so south of Silver Lake proper, but you can be in the heart of that wonderful neighborhood in minutes. More to the point, you can be downtown in 15 minutes if (and this is important) you avoid the temptation to take freeways, which at certain hours will delay you hopelessly. Instead, take Sunset Blvd. to Alvarado St. and it's a straight shot to downtown. My room facing Sunset was slightly noisy due to car traffic on a Saturday night (ask for one facing the other way if this is a concern) but not enough to make a difference to me. Generally speaking, I'd call the immediate surroundings uninteresting, not frightening as some reviewers seem to suggest; there are some pleasant-looking antique shops and a potpourri of ethnic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: razina
Reviews.Content: it was really nice stay! for such amount of money - even better then nice! i am completely satisfied. the rooms are large and clean, with microven and coffe. personal is pleasant. the hotel is situated almost in down town that takes you to Hollywood Blvd with kodak theatre and walk of fame in 5 minutes by car!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great location in silverlake!”
Reviews.Author: mushmush
Reviews.Content: after living in silverlake for over a year and moving back to NYC, i knew i wanted to stay downtown near my old neighborhood for a trip back to LA. but then i found an even better location at the comfort inn, right in the middle of silverlake! it's cheap, i think my rate was $110/nite. and clean. it did smell like smoke a little, i probably could have asked for another room, which i recommend asking for a non smoking room if they have any. but the hotel was good for what it was, i wasnt ever spending much time in there anyways! i was out and about, hanging out, eating, shopping, going out at night. it's so close to my favorite bars and restaurants in silverlake and los feliz, echo park...i recommend the comfort inn! and this is from someone who stays at 5 star hotels for work trips! i don't like wasting my own money on hotels that are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Neat, and Free Parking, too!”
Reviews.Author: NickBeaufortSC
Reviews.Content: A cut above most Comfort Inns, and for less than $100 in LA. Efficiently run, good breakfast, free parking, good security (needed, the neighborhood is not a fancy one). Stayed 3 days on business, would come back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location, but hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: BillyandNic
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is comfortable enough - our room was quite large, the bed was comfy and it was clean and warm. Amenities ok. The public areas of the hotel are nothing much to look at but it's clean and the people are nice. The location is not the best for tourists - we mistakenly thought it was at the Hollywood end of West Sunset Blvd and it is actually miles in the other direction in a slightly seedy seeming neighbourhood where we didn't feel entirely safe. That said, there is good public transport nearby and it's easy to get around. There are a few restaurants and convenience stores, a launderette etc around the place, but not a great variety.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: quest88
Reviews.Content: what a very pleasant surprise. I was not expecting too much of this place and was very surprised by the room, it was large, and quiet with a coffee maker, microwave and fridge. The morning breakfast bar was a great with a good variety of items. Loved the make your own waffles which were very good, the only thing bad on the bar was the cheese (yuk!) didn't think cheese could taste yukky, lol. Great location, for driving to hollywood, but not a good location to walk to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about... It's OK!!!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenMJ
Reviews.Content: I booked a five night stay at the Comfort Inn on W. Sunset Blvd and I was overall very pleased with the accommodation. All the bedrooms are large, very clean and quite modern in appearance. The beds are ultra comfortable - large and I would say quite new - the TV works unlike in some hotels and has many channels if you can't be without your TV. Breakfast is OK - very standard and very American - waffle making machine, bagels, pastries, fruit, cereal, etc... Having a car in LA is essential as the public transport is very poor. The hotel is situated on a busy main road. The area is very safe. Car parking for guests at the hotel is free and there is plenty of parking available. The hotel location is very central if you have a car otherwise not so good. After reading all these reviews before I left I was quite unsure whether I wanted to stay here but I can honestly say it was absolutely fine and met all my standards and requirements. If you are thinking about booking a room book with the hotel website www.choicehotels.com direct and select "Internet User" in the Best Available section - you will not get a cheaper price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Back again...no problems”
Reviews.Author: inenbasket
Reviews.Content: Back again.... second time staying at this place in 3 months- although this time not on business so for a little longer. Stopped in LA for while on a well earned vacation taking in a road trip... this was my first choice of place to stay in LA, knowing the city a little better by now. Pretty much the same as my earlier review in mid- september- cheaper than anywhere else I could find except for all but the sleaziest 1* places in dubious locations (inglewood? I wouldn't...) and again, no complaints. People compaining about the location need to remember that the majority of Los Angeles is sleazy.....! Location is honestly nothing to worry about if you have a car ( and you NEED a car ).... Close to the 101 f/way, couple of mins drive to hollywood, easy to get downtown..beverly hills not too far... If you don't have a car, then perhaps look elsewhere... Internet worked flawlessly again (ask for code every day at reception) and is fast, the place is v clean, plenty of room, free secure under the building parking, and its quiet. Once again, with the hiltons et al all pricing up at well over three to four times the price, you have to question why..

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Cain097
Reviews.Content: Pretty good value for the money. This hotel is located only two blocks from the Chinese Theater and major Hollywood attractions. Parking is free which is a huge advantage. Free continental breakfast is nothing special. The rooms are reasonably sized and recently renovated with plasma TV's, fresh paint, and rather comfortable beds. We stayed one night, but highly recommended for people partying in the downtown Hollywood area. Only negative, cable didn't work properly and making the channels unwatchable. Also, you could hear the traffic (including alarms) and other guests at all hours of the nice. Basically expected for a Hollywood motel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Uncharmed”
Reviews.Author: heatherwritesmovies
Reviews.Content: I booked my family to stay in this hotel in August 2006 and we had minimal problems. However, I booked a single night in May 2007 and I had some major problems. In particular, managment refuses to allow you to check in before check-in time. Fine. This is their policy. However... We received a phone call every five minutes from 11:30 a.m. to Noon the next morning to "remind" us to check out on time. I felt this was pushy and uncalled for. If I am not allowed to check in a minute early, why should I check out before noon? This hotel is safe with free parking and clean - which is more than you can say for most "affordable" hotels in Los Angeles. Unfortunately, like most other things in LA, you pay a lot for very, very little.

Reviews.Title: “Well!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alisonbry
Reviews.Content: Well having just arrived at this hotel from San Diego (Tula Vista Comfort Inn) i can honestly say i am absolutley disappointed with this place. It is in a rough neighbourhood have no doubts a walk down the street will tell you this. It is not near to anywhere you will need a car to get anywhere of importance.Do not stay here if you are planning a vacation base because this is at the very west end of sunset boulevard nearly in the city of LA. We have just been into town to get something to eat the traffic is murder 1 hour in 1 hour back on an 18 mile journey. WOw give me London anytime. The room was dark it is a smoking hotel and the smell in the supposedly non smoking room was horrible. I wanted to be sick thats how bad it was. This hotel lets down badly the comfort inns around the whole area i have just spent 2 weeks travelling staying mostly at comfort inns for their value this is by far the worst and i advise anyone think again spend a few more dollars and stay somewhere more convienent and safer neighbourhood. As for the smoking side you can tell its a smoking joint know what i mean!!!!!!!!! The room is open plan there is not even a door to seperate the the wash room. Avoid if you are on vacation if you want a place to sleep late at night and leave first thing in the morning this is it. If you want a place to remember this is not it avoid!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, & Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: Bendaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 9/28 and 10/7/07 before and after a cruise. Both rooms were neat, clean and appeared to be recently refurbished. The wifi worked well, you just have to call down and get the password and user ID, no charge for use.Free copies of the USA Today. Large selection of cable channels to choose from including HBO. Both rooms had a frige and microwave. Bathrooms were spotless. Breakfast is served from 6:30 til 9:30 includes Belgian waffle. I would reccomend this hotel. Staff friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: NYCroadtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were pleasantly surprised, having stayed at less impressive Comfort Inns around the country. The hotel is a short drive away from trendy Silver Lake. The rooms are surprisingly clean, and the property is very secure, with multiple security cameras in the building. The parking garage underneath is a little crazy, but otherwise a good experience, especially for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be the best hotel value in L.A.!”
Reviews.Author: Sukki007
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the many good reviews I read here on Trip Advisor. This is my last night in this hotel and I couldn't be happier with the choice. I don't usually travel alone, and though a New York City native, I did have some trepidation about staying alone in a hotel in L.A. I agree with all of the reviewers who mentioned the excellent security at this hotel. There are cameras everywhere and yes, the front desk is behind a glass partition. Rather than making me nervous by their mere existence, they really have made me feel safer. As for the rooms, I cannot understand how other reviewers have described this place as a basic, no-frills hotel. My room is extremely spacious, as are most of the others I've seen in passing. All the rooms I've seen have been renovated: the vanity is granite, with a new faucet. The bathtub surround is flat-panel stone, with NONE of the grout and tiles that can be covered with mold. In fact, the bedroom and bath are spotless. There's a small, quiet refrigerator and a microwave that sits on granite shelves, and both are also completely clean. The king-sized bed is covered in a luxurious-looking burnt-orange shiny quilted new-looking bedspread. The bed itself could be a little softer, but it's not rock-hard either; this non-sleeper has slept well. Even the entry doorsill and hinges have been replaced. There is a desk, armoire, table, and three chairs, and there is still a huge amount of room to walk around. The carpet is not old, but during my stay all of the rooms were having the carpets restretched and cleaned. The shower is good, with a new, adjustable showerhead. The lighting is good in the bedroom and bathroom, and there are two telephones. My only complaint is that the table and one of the chairs could use replacement. The lobby is small, but furnished with newer furniture in excellent condition, and the small breakfast room is bright and modern, too. A number of people wrote about the somewhat seedy neighborhood. Having driven back all the way on Sunset from West Hollywood to the hotel, the neighborhood does change - stores and restaurants are closed and largely ethnic, mostly Hispanic. It certainly does not have the glitz and polish and lighting of the areas I was coming from. But not once did I feel unsafe. I did not use the underground parking, because the lobby is at one end of a small strip mall with outdoor parking, and I was able to park one foot away from the hotel lobby. After booking this hotel by calling Choice's 800 number, I later did a comparison on Choice Hotel's own website among this hotel and four other Comfort Inns in the area. I was dismayed to see that this was the only one that did not have high speed internet service listed for the rooms. I was about to cancel my reservation, but then decided to call Choice to verify it. They made a direct call to the hotel and told me that they did indeed have high speed in all the rooms. I am using it right now, and it has worked perfectly. I did not have a chance to check out the actual breakfast - I either slept in or had to leave very early before they began serving. But on my first morning I asked the desk after breakfast was over if I might be able to get some bread for toast. No problem. The guy at the desk called and got the woman in charge of breakfast to come down and get me some food. She gave me a plate of bread and pastries and, of course, there is always coffee available. In closing, I must say that I am a snob about hotels. I absolutely cannot stay in an old room; I find it too depressing. And I'm squeamish and easily skeeved, and will not tolerate anything that is not immaculate. Also, I always stay in smoking rooms. This hotel room was not only one step away from being sterilized, it is also the only smoking room I've been in anywhere that doesn't have that nauseating, suffocating smell of stale smoke. And that goes for the hallways, too, despite what one woman wrote about it. I can sniff out smoke anywhere, at any time, but not at this place. They're certainly doing something right. This Comfort Inn has got to be the best deal in L.A. For $81 a night, you cannot get better. And I'd wager that your room in a high-rise hotel would not be any nicer. As long as you have a car and a map, it would be very short-sighted to stay somewhere else. If I return to L.A., this will be my first, and only, choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! We will definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jewelzz111
Reviews.Content: This was actually our first visit to Los Angeles. We're glad we booked this Comfort Inn for our first night. The hotel is very nice, very clean and comfy. The guy at the front desk was friendly and the rest of the staff, too. We had a huge room with two comfy queen beds, clean linens, clean carpet, clean walls, clean bath and clean furniture. There was a fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, iron, tv and hair dryer in the room. They also have free internet, free gated parking and free breakfast with coffee, juice, hot chocolate, fresh waffles, donuts, bagels, fruit and toast. The area didn't seem to be the safest, but we felt very safe inside the hotel. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An OK stay”
Reviews.Author: Rich16
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all, i guess just a regular comfort inn, room had a Microwave, refrigerator, huge comfy bed, huge room as well, room internet worked as well, even had a fax sent to the hotel, not a problem, only bad thing was we should have known that the there was a $ 42 dollar Flat rate for a taxi cab ride from LAX (Los Angeles International Airport to any Sunset Blvd. hotel... oh well charge it to experience...

Reviews.Title: “An above average Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: fromdelmar
Reviews.Content: If I could, I would rate this motel a 3 1/2, as it is a little above average, but not really equal to motels rated as 4. This was our second stay here and again I want to state this is a very well run motel with good housekeeping, convenient, free garage parking, and slightly above average continental breakfast. It is a good value. Smoking: if you smoke this is not a problem, but even in the non smoking rooms you might have a stale smoking odor. I didn't encounter any actual smoke during my visit, in the rooms, halls or lobby. The odor is probably caused by past smoking in the halls that leaks into the room. Location: The location is convenient (if you have a car) midway between downtown Los Angeles and Hollywood. There is a bus on Sunset Blvd., but I recommend that you have a car. One last point: Don't confuse this Comfort Inn with the one near McArthur Park. This motel is in the Echo Park neighborhood. While a little questionable in my opinion, the improving Echo Park neighborhood is superior to the McArthur Park neighborhood. Nevertheless, I wouldn't recommend walking in the Echo Park neighborhood at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: ViviLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Comfort inn is the perfct hotel to stay in L.A for low budget. It is a very clean and safe hotel , with free breakfast, free Wi-fi, free gated parking. I rented a car and I found the location just perfect. I recommend to everybody in fact I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely o.k.”
Reviews.Author: opinion_my
Reviews.Content: We spent here 3 nights in April and had a clean, spacious and quite room (not to the boulevard), free parking, free breakfast and free internet for a good price ($84/night). The Hotel is located - of course by car - not far from freeway, Hollywood/Beverly Hills and Universal Studios (coupons available in the flysheet-rack at the entrance of the hotel - you get a discount). Neighbourhood? There are better I suppose but we didn't care about it, as we had not the intention to take a walk in the evening and...the nicer the neighbourhood, the higher the price. Breakfast was o.k: Waffels are good but all these artificial and/or low fat products (milk, butter, sugar, cheese etc.) and all the plastic (tableware, cutlery) needed getting used to me (but is not hotel-specific). Yes, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: smilinsarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in four different hotels os similar caliber during a week long road trip through Southern California and the Comfort Inn West Sunset by far had the biggest, most well-appointed rooms and the cheapest rate. We only stayed here for one night, but the refrigerator and microwave would have been handy for a longer stay. The neighborhood isn't the greatest, but this hotel has taken several measures to ensure the safety of its guests. We stopped by the continental breakfast on our way out and it was more expansive than I've seen at similar hotels. I couldn't get the wi-fi connection to work in our room, but I saw someone getting an ethernet cable from the front desk when we were checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine.”
Reviews.Author: lyrae
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here for one night when my flight out of LAX was bumped a day. To me, it is in a fantastic location, near Silver Lake, Echo Park, and Los Feliz, all areas worth checking out. It's also spitting distance from the 101 and a block over from a 7/11 if you are so inclined. I think if you find this neighbourhood fearsome you are a bit precious -- I parked outside and the car was fine, and at no point in my travels did I feel unsafe. I'm pretty sure most experienced travellers would feel fine. Everything was very clean. I was given a corner king room which felt tucked away and private. The TV had a lot of channels. The free wireless internet was appreciated -- that always seals the deal for me. (My room was too far from the access point to get a signal, but I was given an ethernet cable by the front desk, which is fine.) In the morning there was juice, all kinds of baked goods (frozen & thawed, but that's alright), waffle batter, fruit, etc. It was much more than what I expect from a continental breakfast. My only issue with the hotel was the rate -- I had a coupon from a local guidebook, but the rate was actually $10 more. The clerk said that they had raised the rate after the book was printed. In my view, the advertised rate should be honoured, as that was what brought me to the hotel. But really, it's a clean, relatively cheap place near some good neighbourhoods and the freeway. I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Average At Best”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaf
Reviews.Content: Location is reasonably convenient, but rather rough. Parking is included, and secured at night. At check-in, reservation through Hotels.com was not in the computer system, but the rate was honored. Service was adequate in the day, surly at night. Rooms were average. Mattress was very hard. Walls were EXTREMELY thin, could hear normal conversation (and worse) easily word for word. Bathroom was clean, with engineered stone walls in the shower/bath (better than I expected). Breakfast (included) was typical continental. Waffles were a plus. Overall, not quite "average" but maybe earns the rating given the price. Definitely not worthy of anything higher. Would have been worth shelling out a few extra bucks for a different place.

Reviews.Title: “very good one night stay”
Reviews.Author: isogood
Reviews.Content: just for one night in january, but a good stay, hotel is very clean, well secured, parking easy, and a little but good breakfast. rooms are large and clean, quiet if you are not on the boulevard. a very good value for the price, just a little far from sites and action. recommended if you look for a good quality/price value. patrick

Reviews.Title: “great find in los angeles”
Reviews.Author: man_from_Brum
Reviews.Content: It took me ages to find a hotel worth staying at for a good price in Los angeles but we found it in this hotel. check in was easy and the room was massive,the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.The complementary breakfast was great (waffles toast muffins juice) the only thing i found is the misleading distance to the centre of hollywood it is to far to walk so you need to use transport car or bus. Other than that its a great hotel.one other thing if you are a vegetarian or vegan there is a vegan restaurant right next door to the hotel that sell good priced food with great service

Reviews.Title: “5 people, 1 room, 1 week”
Reviews.Author: odea
Reviews.Content: 5 of us chipped in to get 1 room with 2 queen beds and a rollaway bed for $110 a night for 7 nights before tax. Pro's: great price, about 15-20 minute drive to sunset strip, always open space in the free secure parking under the hotel, friendly staff, clean and quiet place, breakfast buffet from 630am-930am restocked throughout the morning so you're not going to miss out on certain food by getting up late, leftover coffee and juice still available after 9:30am, room fridge, microwave, and a/c all worked great, decent thai food place downstairs, good hot water pressure in shower, some decent restaurants and convenience/liquor stores within a several minute drive up w. sunset Cons: on the 3rd floor there was NO wifi signal at all (too weak to even show up, wired ethernet was fine,) the remote to our tv did not work (we tried new batteries) and we complained once but it wasn't taken care of, the tv only got 12 channels because it wasn't programmed properly, the bathroom was very small (door almost touches shower,) inconvenient having to recode all room keys daily at the front desk, scraped the bottom of our rental several times going over the steep hump into the garage, rock hard beds Overall, great value and good place to sleep, get cleaned up, and eat breakfast before going out. With no pool, gym or lounge, and spotty wifi and tv, not somewhere too exciting to relax all day. It was a good fit for us and any complaints were minor for the price of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, secure - will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: keylight
Reviews.Content: The location was very easy to get to, and within a few miles of just about everything I was planning to do. The neighborhood is fine. Didn't feel unsafe for a moment. The hotel has very good security, with an underground parking garage, The glass partition between the staff and guests in the lobby was closed for the first 2 days of my stay (mid-late September). On the 3rd day it was open. I asked about this and they said the lock on it was broken and they just got it repaired. Standard breakfast that you find most places these days - bagels, waffles, cereal, juice, milk. All kept very nice and clean with things that needed to be kept cold in a fridge as opposed to a bucket of ice that many places will use. Room was comfortable and clean. Walls seemed a little thin - either that or the guy next to me had his television up really loud. A quick call to the lobby solved the problem. All in all, the place was very well located, clean, and secure. Staff was friendly too. Oh, coffee and orange juice available 24 hours a day - a nice little bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Motts62
Reviews.Content: It was a little disconcerting to come into the lobby and be greeted by the staff behind the security glass. I guess the neighborhood isn't great but they have taken every precaution to make it safe by installing security cams and secured parking. Although the carpeting in the hallways needs replaced, the rooms were very clean, updated, and roomy. The high speed internet access was great and very fast. The hotel even had an ethernet cable that I borrowed since I didn't remember to bring mine. (I'm actually using it to write this review!) Location is good - about 15 minutes from downtown and Hollywood and Universal. Hard to beat this hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “good budget choice.”
Reviews.Author: carlottaghigi
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because on a budget trip which included Los Angeles, and we were plesantly surprised. Not only it was a very convenient solution, but also quite a plesant stay. I would only recomend it for a B/B sort of stay, but we had a nice and clean room, and the complimentary breakfast was better than expected: mostly carb based, but you can make your fresh waffle. Vending machines with anything from water and soda to hot pizza are available on the various floors. The hotel has a free gated parking space, but if you are stuck without a car you can catch the bus right in fron of the hotel which will take you to the nearest metro station in 10 minutes, down town in about 15 and even all the way to Santa Monica, going through West Hollywood and Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth the price”
Reviews.Author: redinsf
Reviews.Content: Staying in LA on a budget is never easy, especially if you have a specific area where you need to be. This hotel is right in the Silverlake/Echo Park area, and is in a great central location to Hollywood and the 101. We ran into no traffic, and while my husband was working, I was able to enjoy the neighborhood. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and accommodating, and there was underground parking that was kept locked at night. There is available DSL and what looks like a decent Thai restaurant open late downstairs (I didn't try it). I would definitely stay here again. For a comfortable stay around $85, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slynnlegaspi
Reviews.Content: Arrived early for check-in front desk was able to accomodate us..which we really appreciated. Appearance of hotel was very clean. neighborhood seemed a little ghetto but we didn't mind...they had a garage that was secured. The room was big and had a fridge and microwave...had free internet..decent channels..Hbo...the only thing was the floor was kind of dirty..i had only wore my socks for 5 mins and they were already dirty...the bed was really hard but we were still able to sleep well...you had to re-key your keys every morning ...free continental breakfast..but didnt really use it..the front desk was really nice when i checked in excpet for this one girl who didnt even know what was around the area...overall good motel for a very short stay but next time i think i'll pay a little more for a nicer place

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: dacytx
Reviews.Content: Hotel very spacious and clean, had fridge and microwave. Great breakfast with lots of options. Nice staff and very central location to many sights. Too far to walk to Hollywodd but short drive, not to many restraunts in the area. Free parking garage that always has plenty of space and limited access.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn - Los Angeles / West Sunset Blvd.
HotelInfo.Address: 2717 West Sunset Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90026
